lines.text:
[Chasing a gunman through the streets]
Freeze! Police! FREEZE! I don't know why I tell 'em to freeze - they never freeze.
[Gunman gets hit by cab; goes thru windshield]
He shoulda froze.
Well, it's not like we didn't tell him, man.

[the 2 cops are leading him to an abandoned construction site]
Hey, what is this, man?
Riding around with you all night kinda stunk up our car, pal.
We need a little fresh air. Someplace quiet.
Yeah, someplace you can scream.
Oh, that's funny!

[All 3 are climbing the stairs of an empty building under construction]
Some people told us you like to talk when you get high. Are we high enough yet, Bobby?
I don't know. I swear, I don't know.
Ah, he'll never make a good lawyer, Nick. He can't lie for shit. Come on - MOVE IT! You can go back down. All you have to do is tell us who killed Charles Boudreaux.
All that shit you been mainlining fucked up your leg muscles, didn't it? COME ON!
[They reach the highest accessible floor & approach the edge]
come here, man.
[Shoves Bobby towards the edge of the floor]
Wait... Wait... Don't push. Okay! OKAY, OKAY!
Whaddaya think of that shit, huh?

[Looking down through the open structure]
Oh, my God! Jesus Christ! Oh, God!
I wouldn't have figured you to be the religious type, Bobby.
It must be because we're so close to God up here.
What the fuck is that shit?
Yogurt, yeast paste, lecithin; all the things you ought to be eating. Want some?
No way, man. I'm on a low-mucous diet - you know that.
Yeah.
I been thinking, Frank.
It's DeCosta again, isnt' it?
No, Frank. It's not about DeCosta again. I think we ought to go after the guys that hit Boudreaux. I figure they're local.
Yeah, how do you figure that?
'Cause they're workin' for DeCosta.
There's that name again...
they made us look REAL bad. The entire squad thinks we're screw-ups.
So now, you wanna screw up real big and remove all doubt. Right?
No, I don't wanna do that. I'm just an agile guy, Frank. I can get my foot it my mouth; I can even work with my nose to the grindstone. But my ass doesn't fit under a desk - neither does yours.
No! No! No!

[Three loud knocks are heard on an apartment door. The apartment walls are stacked with electronics boxes]
Who is it?

[Muffled voice heard through locked door]
What's happening, man? Some brothers downtown said you got VCRs for sale.
Get outta here, man! You got the wrong house! I'm a lawyer!
I got cash, motherfucker! I need twenty of 'em!
Whoooooo!
[Casey begins to unlock the door, realizes who it is, tries to re-lock it, and Nick breaks it down]
Hey. I was just on the toilet thinking 'bout yall, man. Ain't life a bitch?

[singing Gimme Some Lovin by the Spencer Davis Group, badly, while playing a guitar in the zoo]
We're so glad you made it - we're so glad you made it. Gimme some lovin'; GIMME SOME A-LOVIN'!
[an elephant trumpets]
You could make animals sick with that shit. You should cool out.
[Climbs onto a bike to leave]
Hey, how about that, man. You got any more room on that bicycle?
Hey, hey, hey! I been working on this a LONG time, man.

[Coroner is leading a group of cops through the morgue to a drawer]
Visitors, Mendez. Rise & shine!

[Obviously nauseated]
I hate morgues.
Yeah, that's him. Joseph Mendez, professional hit-man, worked free-lance.
Didn't like women or kids, either. This guy was a bad-ass.
Really, because, I mean; he hasn't given me a bit of trouble.
[Slaps the corpse gently on the cheek as if to antagonize him]
Yeah, well... I guess we'd better be going.

[Noticing Frank's nausea]
Really, I was in the middle of ordering lunch before you guys came up here, uuh...
[Grabs up a phone & pretends to be ordering]
Hi, yeah, uuh... Make it a pastrami & a small Sprite. You sure I can't interest you guys in anything?
No, thanks anyway, man.
Goddammit.
Old MacDonald had a shotgun.
Shut up.

[Nick has talked his way into his old house, where his ex-wife still lives]
Where's my walleye?
What?

[Pointing to an empty shelf]
My walleye?
I... threw it back.
You threw out my walleye? That was the biggest walleye caught in Bay Lake, Minnesota. That was a record!
Then why didn't you take it to YOUR place.
'Cause I'm not settled in yet.
Oh, geez, Nick. It's only been TWO YEARS!
I'm slow to adjust to psychological upheaval.

[Malcolm is walking through a cemetery stealing flowers, then places them in front of an urn & begins to pray as he opens the urn]
Ashes to ashes; dust to dust, huh man?
Aww, man... You guys ain't got no respect for the dead.
All right, come on out of there, Malcolm.

[Nick begins pulling bags of white powder from the urn, and tasting them]
What do we got here? A little blow? A LOTTA blow. Hey, this is that black tar, isn't it?
Yeah, yeah. I'm thinking about getting into the roofing business.

[Nick opens a larger bag of yellowish powder & tastes it]
What's this? This shit - what is it?
Actually, that's my mother.
[Spits the ashes back into the bag]
You know, I cannot figure out why it is every time I talk to that woman I say the wrong thing. Why is that?
You always shoot your mouth off before your brain is loaded. That's why.
So DeCosta represents your father, and you scarf all of this junk food to fulfill an oral longing for your mother's breasts, which incidentally are 70% fat.
Oh, that's great, Frank. First, you ruin food for me; now you gotta ruin tits.

[Nick & Frank have hung Bobby upside-down from a tall building to scare him into telling them who killed a witness]
See, it increases blood flow to the brain, Bobby. How's your memory?
Oh, God, I'm gonna throw up.
Technically, you'll be throwing DOWN, Bobby.
Oh, God, please. Oh, God.
God's got an alibi, chief. Try somebody else.
I killed a LOTTA guys with a shotgun. I always wondered what it felt like... It SUCKS!
[Dies]
Are you guys getting close to something?
DEATH.
Now, I get to see that sweet face! I'm gonna give you a 'niner'.

[She kisses him on the cheek nine times in quick succession]
Ooh, that was fun.
Yeah.
[Wipes face]
Frank sends his love.
He's a sweetheart. I bet he saves your life.
Not that often.
You are a very sick man. You know that?
Yea-a-a-h!

[to 2 men in drag]
Ladies, PLEASE! This is a house of God!

[looking at stacks of identical VCR boxes]
All this yours, brother?
Uh, yeah brother. Well, see; I'm 'bout to get married. You know how everybody gives you the same present?
Oh, ye- yeah!
Oh, yeah - that's right. That's right. What - you get this $8,000 Rolex for, uh, Christmas, right?
Yeah, I got that from my lady.
how come it's engraved "With Love, to Dr. Ira Kettlebaum"? Check it out.

[thinking briefly]
That's what the bitch calls me, man. Yeah.
Oh, it's like a pet name, right? Yeah.
[imitating a woman's shrill voice]
"Stick it to me Doctor Kettlebaum!" Oooh-oooh! She's a real squealer & shit?
Yeah, she's a freak.
Squealer, right? Yeah.
You're new around here. What's your name?
Malcolm.
Malcolm?
Yeah. What are you - welcome wagon?
Yeah. I've seen you oozing around the street. What is your scam?
Who me? Uh, I sell Amway products. Ha ha...
Yeah, ha ha. I catch you dealing any soap flakes in this neighborhood, I will cripple you.
I ain't afraid of no jive-ass cop, man. I KNOW my rights.
[turns to leave]
I am NOT your normal jive-ass cop, all right? And around here, you GOT no rights!
Oww! You must be 'Berzerk'!
You don't know the half of it, baby.
[throws him into a garbage pile]

[grunting in pain & cluthching his wrist]
Aah...
have a nice day.

[Repeated Lines]
Hi, Speed. How they hangin'?

[approaching a seedy mud-wrestling bar]
I gotta be honest with ya, Nick. I got an aversion to MUD!
That's probly because it resembles that health-food crap you been scarfin'. Didn't ya ever make mud pies when you were a kid?

[entering the bar & pausing in the doorway to take in the atmosphere]
Nice ambiance. Of course, once the yuppies discover this place, it's gonna be SWAMPED!

[noticing 2 bikini-clad women wrestling in a mud pit]
Wouldn't you like to get in there with 'em?
You've got no respect for the human body.
Sure I do!

[Attempting to intimidate Det. Barzak into stopping an interrogation and letting him go]
On the homicide hit-parade, YOU are number one WID' A BULLET, Jack!
